topic.title: HP Helion 2.0 Development Platform: Installing the Horizon UI Panels for Service Management

body.p: This document shows how to install the Horizon UI panels for the Application Lifetime Service (ALS) and Database as a Service (DBaaS).

section.title: 1. Pre-requisites
section.p: You will need the following pieces of information in order to run the service updates.

row.entry: The IP address of the base node for your Helion installation.
The IP address of the seed node for your Helion installation.
The username of a cloud admin that has rights to perform a service update for the selected service.
The password of a cloud admin that has rights to perform a service update for the selected service.

The private key file for the heat-admin user.
Usually available within the root user account on the seed node here: ~/.ssh/id_rsa

The Swift container that contains the service update.
Defaults to als-horizon-ui for ALS. Defaults to dbaas-horizon-ui for DBaaS.
The filename of the service update. This can typically can be found inside the Swift container that contains the service update.

body.section: 2. Configure each serviceReturn to the Helion Development Platform UI and click Configure for each service to complete configuration.
